segments.content: Written by
Mort Briskin & David Klass
Transcribed by
IMSDb

Inspired by a true story.

               We home in on a boat coming in to shore. Off walks a man, he 

               is carrying a backpack and wearing shades.

He walks through a town, passing various stores and the general 

               bustle of the people there. He notices a baby in a pram left 

               out on the sidewalk, then sees the mother is in an alleyway doing 

               what looks like a drug deal.

Chris reads a closure notice on the door. A police car rolls 

               up.
How ya doin'?
Ok. When'd the mill close?
Ahh 3 years this August. If ya lookin
for work you might wanna try Aberdeen,
that's the closest mill work you're
gonna find around here.
That's too bad.
Nah just simple economics. Y'know we
have a really nice casino here, the
wild cherry. You wanna make some money
maybe you wanna go on down there and
try your luck at the blackjack tables.
Chris turns around and the sheriff notices his name on a bag.

character.name: Nah I don't think so. Thanks.

dialogue.text: Chris turns around and the sheriff notices his name on a bag.

segments.content: The sheriff chuckles and steps out of the car.

dialogue.text: The sheriff chuckles and steps out of the car.

segments.content: Well hell, I know all about you Chris.
I know your folks, I'm sheriff Stan
They shake hands.

dialogue.text: They shake hands.

segments.content: How ya doin.
Ralston get outta the car, you're lookin
at a real soldier here pay some respect.
Welcome home soldier.
Thanks.
Here Chris, (opens the back door) We'll
give ya a ride up to your folks.
Nah I'm fine thank you.
I insist.
I'll walk.
Hey it's my pleasure.
It's ok.
I won't take no for an answer (jokingly
reaches for his gun). HEY! Get in the
car.
Chris raises his hands and the sheriff chuckles.
Did I scare ya with that one?
Lil bit.
INT. POLICE CAR

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE CAR

segments.content: You were gone a while huh?
8 years. Harstad was sheriff back then.
Harstad, yeah. Sad story. About 5 months
back he fell asleep at the wheel and
uhhh... hit a tree. Good man, good man
and a good sheriff.
Thanks for the ride.
No problem, and uh Chris (hands him
a piece of paper). It's election month...
Chris takes the paper and smiles. He walks up the lane toward the house, a simple white building clad in wood. A lady dressed in a police uniform comes out.

dialogue.text: Chris takes the paper and smiles. He walks up the lane toward the house, a simple white building clad in wood. A lady dressed in a police uniform comes out.

segments.content: Chris laughs.

dialogue.text: Chris laughs.

segments.content: Lil' brother.. You come over here and
gimme a hug.
They laugh together.
You look great.
What is this?
Hey, I couldn't let you be the only
one looking good in uniform. Hey ma!
Chris is here!
What's with the tent? (points to a tent
set up on the lawn).
Oh, that's for Pete.
Look at you!
Chris hugs his mother, Connie. A man slowly emerges from the front door.

dialogue.text: Chris hugs his mother, Connie. A man slowly emerges from the front door.

segments.content: How long do we have ya for?
For good. I'm home.
Really? You're not kiddin.
They hug again.

dialogue.text: They hug again.

segments.content: Hey dad.
INT. KITCHEN The family are eating takeaway.

dialogue.text: INT. KITCHEN The family are eating takeaway.

segments.content: I wish you would have told me you were
coming I would've cooked.
This is great.
So what are you gonna do now that you're
home?
Well I was planning on working at the
mill, your letters never mentioned that
it was closed.
We didn't wanna bother you with our
problems when your father got laid off.
I got my business, you saw the furniture
outside.
I substitute at the elementary school,
Michelle pitches in. We try to keep
things simple.
A kid walks in.
Pete! This is your Uncle Chris.
Hey Pete.
Sit down, say hello. Last time he saw
you you were barely walking.
And now I'm camping.
I said you could sleep on the couch.
It was Chris' room first.
Your tent's gonna take on water. I could
show ya how to rig it.
Doesn't look like it's gonna rain to
me Colonel.
Pete, cmon sit down, have somethin to
eat.
First of all I was a sergeant. I worked
for a living.
Did you ever smoke anybody?
Pete!
Pete!
Y'know, Papa's still got your gun locked
up in the garage. Think you could teach
me how to shoot?
I figured that'd be scrap metal by now
dad.
No, I'm still hoping that you'll melt
that thing down on your own.
Sorry Pete.
Whatever. I'm outta here Mom.
Okay, be back by ten.
Ten thirty (as he walks out)
Ten!
INT. BEDROOM We can see from the window that it's raining heavily outside. Chris sets about unpacking his things. Pete comes in looking wet.

dialogue.text: INT. BEDROOM We can see from the window that it's raining heavily outside. Chris sets about unpacking his things. Pete comes in looking wet.

segments.content: Ok it rained. Happy?
Pete looks at him.

character.name: No. Why dontcha crash on the floor?

dialogue.text: Pete looks at him.

segments.content: Ok, I'll crash on the floor, you crash
on the bed.
uh uh. (starts walking out)
Pete. (hands him a towel). Keep ya dry.
Chris looks at him. EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE A crappy camper van rolls up. A man steps out.

dialogue.text: Chris looks at him. EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE A crappy camper van rolls up. A man steps out.

segments.content: Ray Ray! Ahaaa.
They hug.

dialogue.text: They hug.

segments.content: How ya doin?
I'm alright.
What is that? (points to the van)
That's the lovemachine.
Ray shrugs.

dialogue.text: Ray shrugs.

segments.content: How ya been?
Good. Clean livin.
Wanna beer?
No. Believe it or not I quit drinkin.
I'll take a soda though.
Here.
Thanks man.
Whoah. (spots a tattoo of a guitar on
Ray's arm).
Ya like that? When you left town it
gave me the idea that I should do something
with my life too so uhh I went down
to Seattle, got a guitar and became
all about music. And then pretty soon
I was about music and drugs, n pretty
soon I was basically just about drugs.
Ended up doin 2 years for B+E.
I'm sorry.
Nahh, look at me now though right? I
been clean and sober for 14 months,
doing construction and renewing those
supportive and healthy friendships from
my past. Matter of fact I talked to
the bastards, told em you were back
and they asked me to politely remind
you that kick off's in twenty minutes.

A group of guys are there waiting, one of them holding a ball. 

               They salute as Chris walks up. They all laugh.
Playin ball?
Let's play ball!
Ray go deep go deep! (as Ray runs off
he throws the ball into Ray's back).
(Spotting a sign that reads 'HAMILTON
FIELD') When did that happen?
His parents hadn't left him the mill
more than 2 minutes before he shut it
down.
a voice shouts 'HEADS UP' Chris catches a fast ball thrown from behind. Jay steps out of his vehicle.

dialogue.text: a voice shouts 'HEADS UP' Chris catches a fast ball thrown from behind. Jay steps out of his vehicle.

segments.content: Cause I opened my Casino.
Still got a gut huh Jay?
Still got your reflexes. What, you get
tired of being all that you can be?
I'm still all I can be.
Really? I'll just have to see about
that. What brings you home?
I just wanna relax, catch my breath.
Another truck with a few guys on it pulls up

dialogue.text: Another truck with a few guys on it pulls up

segments.content: A football game ensues, there are two teams. Jay's guys vs Chris' guys. On the sidelines Pete pulls up on a small motorcycle. Chris notices Pete hanging around with kids smoking. It comes down to the last play, the teams are huddled into two groups talking.

dialogue.text: A football game ensues, there are two teams. Jay's guys vs Chris' guys. On the sidelines Pete pulls up on a small motorcycle. Chris notices Pete hanging around with kids smoking. It comes down to the last play, the teams are huddled into two groups talking.

segments.content: If we score here we win right?
Alright boys, last play. We need to
put this to rest.
Just give me the ball.
You got it. On the first hut!
Chris gets the ball and throws it. An opponent comes in hard and tackles him low. He collapses. Ray runs for the ball but gets clotheslined by Jay.

dialogue.text: Chris gets the ball and throws it. An opponent comes in hard and tackles him low. He collapses. Ray runs for the ball but gets clotheslined by Jay.

segments.content: That's game!
(to Chris) Sorry about that.
Chris Helps Ray onto his feet.

dialogue.text: Chris Helps Ray onto his feet.

segments.content: Welcome home.
Good to be back.
See ya round. Hey, if you're not doing
anythin later on you could come by the
casino. I'll introduce ya to some nice
girls, drinks are on me. Whaddya say?
See ya tonight.
Jay speeds off in his car. Pete rolls up on his bike.

dialogue.text: Jay speeds off in his car. Pete rolls up on his bike.

segments.content: Hey Sarge, good game. Maybe next time.
Hold up. Maybe next time I won't see
you with the bleachers smoking weed.
EXT. OUTSIDE THE WILD CHERRY CASINO

dialogue.text: EXT. OUTSIDE THE WILD CHERRY CASINO

segments.content: Don't you have to be native american
to own a casino?
Oh Hamilton's one sixteenth black man
now.
Just so you guys know, I'm gonna triple
my money tonight.
Yea, like last time. Wound up selling
your body for bus fare.
They all laugh.

dialogue.text: They all laugh.

segments.content: Nobody's gonna have any problems finding
this place.
It's the subtle attention to aesthetics
that I find most impressive, blends
in with the mountains SO nicely.
The place is packed with gambling tables and attractive women.
Not bad huh?
Not bad.
Isn't it wonderful? All your gambling
needs under one great big roof. You
got your ATM machine, tellers to cash
your paycheck, and when you're here
you don't gotta worry about those lil
things like child support, rent, the
laws of mathematical probability.
Gentlemen, Mr Hamilton would like to
invite you to the VIP lounge.
INT. VIP LOUNGE

dialogue.text: INT. VIP LOUNGE

segments.content: Heyyy, the dream team!
Nice place.
Yeah well. Welcome to my world. Look
tonight, all the drinks are on the house.
If you need a line of credit, say how
much. And if you need a lil female companionship...
done. Alright? Have a good time.
Where you goin?
Don't you worry about me, I've got a
few things to do. Enjoy.
Just remember, nothin in here's free.
C'mon, this place is nothin but fake
boobs and real assholes if ya ask me.
Just water for me.
They all down some drinks. They lead Chris down a corridor.

dialogue.text: They all down some drinks. They lead Chris down a corridor.

segments.content: Don't say we never did nothin' for ya!
Don't worry, everybody's a lil scared
the first time. Get in there, sit back
and enjoy.
Chris' friends have led him to a stripping booth, his friend
inserts the money.
If you're not back by morning we'll
send a search party for you.

His friends leave, closing the door behind them. A screen goes up and a striptease begins. The lady is dressed in the style of a firewoman and has a pole in the center of the stage. She dances around the pole and removes clothes.

dialogue.text: His friends leave, closing the door behind them. A screen goes up and a striptease begins. The lady is dressed in the style of a firewoman and has a pole in the center of the stage. She dances around the pole and removes clothes.

segments.content: So you from here or just visiting.
Lil of both, I grew up here.
So you've seen all the old faces.
Could say that.
The lights come on.

dialogue.text: The lights come on.

segments.content: Chris...
The screen goes down again, Chris leaves the booth. INT. CASINO

dialogue.text: The screen goes down again, Chris leaves the booth. INT. CASINO

segments.content: Look who's back.
So, good surprise?
Told you it was better than gambling.
You met Candy? (A girl is dancing on
their table)
INT. CRAPS TABLE

character.name: Hey Candy. (to the guys) Let's go.

dialogue.text: INT. CRAPS TABLE

segments.content: 6! Easy 6 for a win!
(To some girls) We can do a 6.
(To Chris) We're gettin killed out here.
I need you to put 200 down for the bet.
No, hell no.
Look at them (Nods to girls).
Ok.
Five hundred on 6?
Chris notices something odd, he looks concerned.

character.name: Yes, I'm in. Boom! Gimme some dice.

dialogue.text: Chris notices something odd, he looks concerned.

segments.content: Lookin' for a 6.
Jimmy. Don't roll. Gimme the dice.
The dice have landed and it's a 7. Jimmy hangs his head.

dialogue.text: The dice have landed and it's a 7. Jimmy hangs his head.

segments.content: (To the croupier) You're good, but I
saw it.
Saw what?
I saw the switch.
Hey this is a clean game asshole.
Yea?
Yea.
Chris puts a load of money on the table.

dialogue.text: Chris puts a load of money on the table.

segments.content: Bet you I'll roll a seven.
It's not your roll sir. SIR! It's not
your roll. Call security.
Chris has taken the dice.
Put your bets down on the pass line.
These dice are comin up seven.
Chris, why don't we just let it go?
No, we gonna let it ride Jimmy. The
dice are comin up seven.
Chris rolls the dice and sure enough it's a seven.

dialogue.text: Chris rolls the dice and sure enough it's a seven.

segments.content: No folks, no payout.
(To croupier) Why don't you just take
care of that bet and we're even.
Well I would but it wasn't a legitimate
bet, you're not the shooter. It's not
your (Chris shoves him) ROLL sir.
Is there a problem?
Yea, the problem is your dice are loaded.
Does your boss know about this? Just
gimme my money.
The security guy grabs Chris around the neck. Chris elbows him
and throws him onto the table. The croupier takes a fighting
stance. Jimmy taps Chris on the shoulder.

More security men appear, one of them knocks Jimmy out. A whole fight breaks out, Ray gets knocked out. Chris beats off several security men before taking an electric shock to the neck and a baton to the face. Chris wakes up on a table under a light.

character.name: Come on, let's go! let's go!

dialogue.text: More security men appear, one of them knocks Jimmy out. A whole fight breaks out, Ray gets knocked out. Chris beats off several security men before taking an electric shock to the neck and a baton to the face. Chris wakes up on a table under a light.

segments.content: (Sees the tag around Chris' neck) Special
forces? I'll take that.
Chris grabs him by the neck but they beat him down again.
What are you doin?
(Has a scalpel in his hand) Special
forces... special treatment.
He rips open Chris' shirt.
A struggle ensues and Chris' chest is cut up. EXT. A BRIDGE We see Chris is crawling, badly hurt. A truck stops directly in front of him. Chris passes out again. INT. HOSPITAL

dialogue.text: A struggle ensues and Chris' chest is cut up. EXT. A BRIDGE We see Chris is crawling, badly hurt. A truck stops directly in front of him. Chris passes out again. INT. HOSPITAL

segments.content: (To Chris' family) Folks, he's pretty
banged up, inside and out. Whoever did
this left him for dead. A lesser man
wouldn't have survived.
I'm gonna need a statement from him
Doctor.
He's in no condition to give you one.
I'll also need a copy of your write-up
along with toxicoloy, blood alcohol
level and so on.
What are you talkin about Stan?
I'm just tryin to get some facts here.
Oh come on you need to be out arresting
whoever tried to kill my brother not
testing his BLOOD.
I'm just doing my job Michelle. Ok?
I understand how you feel. But we still
don't know yet who started all of this.
Well it wasn't Chris.
Just find out who did this to him Stan.
I'll do my best Mr Vaughn. I really
will. In the meantime I have to file
a full report. You lemme know when I
can talk to him.
The doctor nods.
Thank you.
He's gonna be fine Michelle.
INT. HOSPITAL WARD Ray goes into a room and takes a big bunch of flowers from there.

dialogue.text: INT. HOSPITAL WARD Ray goes into a room and takes a big bunch of flowers from there.

segments.content: BEAUTIFUL flowers!
INT. CHRIS HOSPITAL BED

character.name: Thank you, they're for my best friend.

dialogue.text: INT. CHRIS HOSPITAL BED

segments.content: Hey sarge, so much for our VIP... status.
Don't they teach you any fighting skills
in the army.
How did you do?
Not good. But I tell you, that guy was
feelin me this morning.
Chris begins to laugh but is in pain.
You okay?
Some homecoming hey.
I don't know if you've noticed but this
aint exactly home any more.

Chris has returned home. He's still in bad shape and his parents 

               help him out of the car. He insists on taking the steps by himself.

Chris laughs. INT. LOUNGE A montage ensues with Chris on the couch, sometimes with Ray, other times with Pete. Chris is recovering, and is exercising by the end of it. INT. GARAGE Chris pulls the cover off an old truck. He smiles and gets in. He starts the engine.

character.name: There's some old crutches in the garage.

dialogue.text: Chris laughs. INT. LOUNGE A montage ensues with Chris on the couch, sometimes with Ray, other times with Pete. Chris is recovering, and is exercising by the end of it. INT. GARAGE Chris pulls the cover off an old truck. He smiles and gets in. He starts the engine.

segments.content: Changed the plugs a while back.
Appreciate that Dad.
I might've had serious issues with your
career choice but just didn't seem fair
to take it out on an innocent truck.
Where you headin?
I was goin into town to get some supplies.
Wanna come?
INT. CAR

dialogue.text: INT. CAR

segments.content: Ya whole life, all you wanted to do
was get outta here. What made you come
back.
You gonna think I'm crazy. I been thinking
about the mill. When I was a kid goin
to visit you at work, the smell of that
fresh-cut cedar. You remember that smell.
Mmm I remember a lotta nice things before
the mill closed.
When did they go outta business? (Nods
to a closed supply store).
Closed about six months ago. There's
a home depot about fifteen minutes up
the road.
And that? (Nods to an adult XXX shop)
They laugh. EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE Jay pulls up in his car.

dialogue.text: They laugh. EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE Jay pulls up in his car.

segments.content: Hey. First of all I wanna say thanks.
For what?
He's been fired, and his gaming permit's
been pulled. I don't know how my security
cameras didn't catch that.
Jay starts to help Chris taking wood off the truck but Chris
throws it back on.
They miss a lot at your place don't
they Jay.
Look Chris I hate seein ya like this.
Your boys did it.
Wait wait... so they got a little rough,
they were a bit edgy. Understandably.
You don't know what kind of assholes
they have to put up with on a daily
basis. Look, they've been reprimanded.
They say you went nuts man. I'm sorry.
I know the proper term vets use is post
traumatic stress.
What the fuck are you talking about?
Whatever it was, you tore my place apart
and it wasn't easy for me to get my
guys agree not to press charges. Look
Chris, if you had a problem... shouldn't
you have come to me? Look, I wanna bring
you inside. Chris I wanna make you head
of security. Whaddya say?
No.
Ah well. I guess you probably need time
to think about it. This is for you.
It's a little something to help you
get... Y'know..
He puts down an envelope with money in it. Chris gives it back
to him.
Come on man, don't be like that. I came
all the way out here to your house just
to see you get back on your feet.
I'm goin to the sheriff.
I'm sorry you feel that way. I'll see
ya round Chris.
An officer is on the phone ignoring him.

dialogue.text: An officer is on the phone ignoring him.

segments.content: The sheriff comes out.

dialogue.text: The sheriff comes out.

segments.content: Well hey Chris. Good to see you up and
about, you're lookin spiffy.
I'm here to press charges.
Well this isn't about that incident
at the casino a while back is it?
Yea, it is.
Cause that matter's closed.
Did you look into it?
They did an internal investigation.
That's good enough for me.
An internal investigation.
Chris, I know you're familiar with the
term 'no fly zone'. Hmm? Cause that's
what the casino is. Since the mill closed
down that casino is the main source
of revenue in this town. So, case closed
basically. I'll see ya.
I'm not gonna let this stand.
Excuse me? What did you say to me?
I said I'm not gonna let this stand.
You're lucky to be alive right now,
that's all you need to be concentrating
on. This is my town ok, I'm the sheriff
here. I'll tell you what will stand,
not the other way around. Now please
get out of my building.
Deni is at the door.
Hey.
Hey.
She hands him a leather jacket.

dialogue.text: She hands him a leather jacket.

segments.content: I appreciate that, I thought this was
history.
Coulda left it in the trash but I...
Deni? Nice to see you dear.
Hi Mrs Vaughn.
Can I talk to you outside for a second.
EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE

dialogue.text: EXT. OUTSIDE THE HOUSE

segments.content: How you been?
Been better.
Talked to the sheriff yet?
Well I went down to the police station
and I talked to somebody with a badge.
Sure as hell didn't seem like much of
a sheriff.
He's up for re-election you know. Maybe
you could take his job.
Somebody ought to. How about you?
Sunshine and pine trees. Been readin
these books, teach you how to cultivate
happiness. Books on the future, go with
the flow, that sorta thing.
Is it workin?
I have my moments.
So the casino huh?
Yep. Been there almost a year.
Treatin you good?
Lot better than it treated you.
I like that. Jay Hamilton's done well
for himself hasn't he.
Yea, he's a real go-getter that one.
Must be. I heard he got you.
Lasted about 8 minutes, a long long
time ago.
You still work for him though.
Rent's gotta be paid Chris.
Suppose so.
Hope to see you around.
She begins to drive off.

dialogue.text: She begins to drive off.

segments.content: She toots the horn as she goes. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Connie is on the phone.

dialogue.text: She toots the horn as she goes. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Connie is on the phone.

segments.content: EXT. OUTSIDE SOME GARAGE The Vaughn's truck pulls up at speed. They enter a garage, Pete is on a stretcher.

dialogue.text: EXT. OUTSIDE SOME GARAGE The Vaughn's truck pulls up at speed. They enter a garage, Pete is on a stretcher.

segments.content: It's ok mom he's stabilised. (To Chris)
It was close. Crystal Meth.
I'm sorry. I never did it before.
It's true. We mighta kinda pushed him
into it.
Chris approaches the kid.
Where'd you get the drugs?
I'm not really sure...
Stop. Where?
From the security guys workin at the
casino.
Chris gets into his truck.
Chris, wait. Call the police.
Chris speeds off. He pulls up at their home and enters the garage.

character.name: No, that won't do any good.

dialogue.text: Chris speeds off. He pulls up at their home and enters the garage.

segments.content: Is Pete ok?
Chris is searching about and forces open a cupboard.

dialogue.text: Chris is searching about and forces open a cupboard.

segments.content: Chris pulls out a shotgun and loads it.

dialogue.text: Chris pulls out a shotgun and loads it.

segments.content: Aw Chris not like this. Chris listen
to me. If you go outta here with that
gun, they're gonna.. ne... Chris!

heading.subject: Chris drives to the casino, he cocks the shotgun but decides
heading.raw_text: Chris drives to the casino, he cocks the shotgun but decides

segments.content:
to leave it in the truck. Instead he takes a piece of wood from 

               the back of his truck. He enters the casino with it. He smashes 

               a fruit machine. A guard comes up and Chris beats him. A fight 

               scene breaks out with Chris beating the guards and generally 

               trashing the place. He takes back his special forces dogtag from 

               the guard who stole it. Chris hurls his piece of wood at the 

               VIP lounge window, smashing it to pieces. Jay emerges from behind 

               it.
Guess that changes our relationship
a bit huh?
Chris leaves. As he drives off in his truck, police cars appear
with sirens going. He pulls over.
You should NOT have come looking for
trouble. Keep your hands up, get out
of the vehicle now Chris! NOW!
I advise you to give this offer more
than a little serious thought. If you
go to trial you stand to do 18 years.
This is a sweet plea, normally they
wouldn't even put it on the table but
your military record can't be ignored.
Three months home arrest, some community
service. Pretty generous offer Chris.
But I'd have to plead guilty.
Look at it from the other side. There's
over a dozen witnesses, none of em are
gonna paint a very flattering picture.
We see a montage of casino workers badmouthing Chris.
He started bustin up the machines...
Went crazy...
Complete psychopath.
They're only offering me this deal just
to keep me quiet.
Well I still say you should take it.
INT. COURTROOM

character.name: I wasn't wrong. And I won't say I was.

dialogue.text: INT. COURTROOM

segments.content: Our job is to keep order. But there
was no chance of that. Me and my men
we were just tryin to control him. He
was highly trained, violent, very dangerous
person.
So dangerous, so violent, so highly
trained that he despatched six of the
casino staff single handedly. His weapon
of choice a simple piece of cedar. Which
in his hand became a devastating force
with one aim, to hurt people, destroy
property.
He went directly for everything. He
just came in and took over the place.
You said he broke your arm.
Yea that's correct, my right forearm.

heading.subject: Both bones with a single shot. It was
heading.raw_text: Both bones with a single shot. It was

segments.content: crazy.
You know, toss out a coupla drunks now
and then. Guys try to grope the girls,
but ah nothing with this sort of violence.
Did he give you any kind of advanced
warning? A chance to defend yourself.
We tussled, but he's a big guy. He was
on a mission. Besides, he seemed to
be too busy enjoying himself from what
I could see.
So from what you saw, it seemed like
he had some kinda purpose?
I think he had a point to prove yeah.
I was emptyin machines when Mr Vaugh
came in and started swingin.
I was tryin to get outta there.
Mr Crow, you may present your client's
case.
(To his lawyer) You're fired.
Your honor, I'd like to plead my own
case.
Order, order. Mr Vaughn, if you choose
to represent yourself and not be represented
by legal counsel you realise that you
can't then claim a mistrial on that
basis.
Yes I do.
Very well Mr Vaughn.
I don't deny anything that was said
here today.
Does that mean you're changing your
plea to guilty?
I'm not guilty of anything. Except standing
up for myself when the law wouldn't.
Objection. He's trying to introduce
prior events your honor.

heading.subject: Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.
heading.raw_text: Sustained. Mr Vaughn stay on point.

segments.content: I grew up in this town. People used
to walk tall in this town, they wouldn't
have traded the mill for a crooked casino.
Mr Vaughn we're not here to listen to
civic speeches.
And they wouldn't have stood around
while drugs were being sold to kids.
Objection.
Sustained. Mr Vaughn you're close to
being held in contempt.
I was justified in what I did, and if
you acquit me of these charges I'm gonna
run for sheriff. And if elected, I'm
gonna fix this town.
Order, order. Mr Vaughn you are now
charged with contempt.
And I will make sure that THIS (He opens
his shirt revealing huge scarring) never
happens to anyone again without punishing
those who did it.
I order the jury to ignore what they
have just seen. Mr Vaughn take your
seat. Order! Order!
Mr Forman, has the jury reached a verdict?
We have your honor.
Will the defendant please rise.
We find the defendant Chris Vaughn not
guilty.
The crowd breaks into cheer. Chris takes a tag from his piece
of cedar wood which is laying on the evidence table.
The crowds fade away with chants of 'Sheriff Vaughn'. EXT. POLICE STATION Chris pulls up to the station in his police truck, it's clear he's now the sheriff.

dialogue.text: The crowds fade away with chants of 'Sheriff Vaughn'. EXT. POLICE STATION Chris pulls up to the station in his police truck, it's clear he's now the sheriff.

segments.content: Sheriff.
Watkins.
Well you won the election, congratulations.
We do have a tradition of professional
courtesy up here, and I can personally
vouch for each and every one of these
men. They're good deputies.
INT. POLICE STATION Chris takes a look around. EXT. A COUNTRY ROAD Jay is speeding along in a sportscar. He is pulled over by a police truck.

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION Chris takes a look around. EXT. A COUNTRY ROAD Jay is speeding along in a sportscar. He is pulled over by a police truck.

segments.content: Hey Chris.
License and registration please.
You're joking right?
Jay hands it over.

dialogue.text: Jay hands it over.

segments.content: What's the problem sheriff?
You. And the drugs you're pedalling
out of your casino.
Oh. Only thing that's going on in my
casino right now is reconstruction.
You took care of that.
Yea that's right and I plan on taking
care of everything else too.
If you can, try to think this through.
A casino is a license to print money.
Why would I jeopardise that by selling
drugs?
Cause you owned the town Jay. It's changed
now.
Really? See the only thing that I think
has changed around here is that every
morning you get to wake up and put on
that nifty lil badge. But underneath
that badge is the same guy that couldn't
make it playing college football, apparently
couldn't make it in the army and not
gonna make it as a cop.
Is that right?
Yea, and if you push too hard you're
gonna be a man who doesn't live to see
40. License please.
Chris hands it over.
Thanks sheriff.
Sir get your tail lights fixed, it's
your last warning.
Chris smashes up the back end of Jay's car with his trusty piece of cedar wood.

character.name: What's wrong with my tail lights?

dialogue.text: Chris smashes up the back end of Jay's car with his trusty piece of cedar wood.

segments.content: EXT. RAY'S PLACE

dialogue.text: EXT. RAY'S PLACE

segments.content: Mornin sheriff.
Chris tosses Ray a badge.

dialogue.text: Chris tosses Ray a badge.

segments.content: No, nope, no. Come on man you know I
hate cops. You been sheriff 2 minutes
and I'm already startin to hate you.
I'm a convicted felon.
I got a lil pull around here.
Oh now you're a CROOKED cop doing favours
for friends. That's how it starts. See
next thing you know you'll be taking
bribes, setting up roadblocks, frisking
dudes crotches.
Are you done? Ray I need your help.
Oh don't do that.
I need you to take me to drugs school.
A montage ensues, with Chris and Ray busting various drug dealers. EXT. DEALER'S HOUSE

character.name: I get to wear a uniform?

dialogue.text: A montage ensues, with Chris and Ray busting various drug dealers. EXT. DEALER'S HOUSE

segments.content: You're SURE you're not carrying anything.
I don't have shit.
Officer.
Yeah.
Search him.
Oh. Spread your legs, arms down. Been
workin out? Nothin there. Ohhhh somebody
needs a BATH!
Now you read me my rights and take me
in. And I call my lawyer.
K. I have a hunch there may be somethin
else in here (Pats the dealer's truck).
Music plays while the two chop up the dealer's car into pieces while laughing.

dialogue.text: Music plays while the two chop up the dealer's car into pieces while laughing.

segments.content: He's clean. Guess we gotta move to plan
Screw you, I do have a bit of information
for you. It's not just me actually,
there's a whole lotta people in on this
one.
Spit it out.
INT. FAMILY HOUSE Chris is in the room with a shotgun.

dialogue.text: INT. FAMILY HOUSE Chris is in the room with a shotgun.

segments.content: Why does it always have to be your fight?
You might need this.
No. I put my guns down a long time ago.
You're just being stubborn.
You and me both boy. Chris, listen.
You be careful.
INT. POLICE STATION Booth is locked up, Ray is taunting him through a loudspeaker.

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION Booth is locked up, Ray is taunting him through a loudspeaker.

segments.content: Please step away from the vehicle. Now
Mr Booth are you still upset over that
body cavity search? WOOOOOOOO! I forgot,
you got no vehicle. Please disperse,
there is nothing to s...
Chris has walked in.
Can I talk to you?
Yeah.
Over here?
Sure.
I'm gonna stay with him tonight. I need
you to take care of my parent's place.
You think they're gonna take it that
far?
I'm with you man, I'll check in later.
NIGHT TIME Deni comes into the police station.

dialogue.text: NIGHT TIME Deni comes into the police station.

segments.content: Don't shoot.
Hey
Hi. How's the food around here? Brought
you special treats. Salmon, Fried Chicken,
Potato Salad. You got cups?
Don't you have to work tonight?
Hmm I quit. I figured you know, you
were making some changes around here,
Chris grabs her and they kiss. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray is on the couch and has just woken to a noise.

character.name: I could make a few myself.

dialogue.text: Chris grabs her and they kiss. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray is on the couch and has just woken to a noise.

segments.content: Who's that?
It's Pete. Want something to eat?
INT. POLICE STATION

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION

segments.content: I gotta get a bigger bed.
EXT. WILD CHERRY CASINO Jay calls a number on his celphone.

dialogue.text: EXT. WILD CHERRY CASINO Jay calls a number on his celphone.

segments.content: INT. POLICE STATION

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION

segments.content: I'm hungry.
Got leftovers...
Mm mmm, I want pancakes, and eggs, and
bacon.
A loud explosion happens, it's Chris' police truck outside.
WOOOOOOOOOOOO! I told you Vaughn! Uh
ohhhh. Who needs to step away from the
vehicle now Vaughn? Truck for truck
baby, that's right, truck for a truck.
Chris steps towards the front of the building but men outside
open fire, Chris ducks for cover.
(To Deni) Get down!
INT. POLICE STATION Men with machine guns are still firing at the police station. Deni's screaming, Booth is cheering.

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION Men with machine guns are still firing at the police station. Deni's screaming, Booth is cheering.

segments.content: Chris gives Deni a pistol. INT. FAMILY HOUSE

character.name: Take that and get in there.

dialogue.text: Chris gives Deni a pistol. INT. FAMILY HOUSE

segments.content: Ray steps into the kitchen but gunmen have infiltrated the home. A fight breaks out and Pete flees. Ray jumps onto the back of a gunman. INT. POLICE STATION Chris shoots up the floor with a shotgun and breaks a hole in it. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray stabs the gunman with a potato peeler and knocks him out with a frying pan. INT. POLICE STATION

dialogue.text: Ray steps into the kitchen but gunmen have infiltrated the home. A fight breaks out and Pete flees. Ray jumps onto the back of a gunman. INT. POLICE STATION Chris shoots up the floor with a shotgun and breaks a hole in it. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray stabs the gunman with a potato peeler and knocks him out with a frying pan. INT. POLICE STATION

segments.content: (To Deni) Come here.
They get down into the hole in the floor.
When I say 'now' start shooting, over
there. Stay low.
Booth is now under fire and is scared.
INT. FAMILY HOUSE Two other gunmen in stocking masks are holding the family hostage upstairs.

character.name: Vaughn you gotta get me outta here!

dialogue.text: INT. FAMILY HOUSE Two other gunmen in stocking masks are holding the family hostage upstairs.

segments.content: I know who you are.
The gunman takes off his mask and hits him with a pistol.

dialogue.text: The gunman takes off his mask and hits him with a pistol.

segments.content: (Calling downstairs) Burke?
He goes downstairs to find Burke dead on the kitchen floor. He follows traces of blood across the floor. INT. POLICE STATION Chris is making his way towards Booth under fire.

dialogue.text: He goes downstairs to find Burke dead on the kitchen floor. He follows traces of blood across the floor. INT. POLICE STATION Chris is making his way towards Booth under fire.

segments.content: C'mon! Get me outta here man!
What's it worth to you? Where's the
lab?
Gunshots hit near booth.

dialogue.text: Gunshots hit near booth.

segments.content: Ok! Ok! Hamilton's operation is at the
mill ok! It's at the mill now get me
outta here.

heading.subject: The gunman enters a room, Ray is there pointing a shotgun at
heading.raw_text: The gunman enters a room, Ray is there pointing a shotgun at

segments.content: him.
INT. POLICE STATION

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION

segments.content: Booth is standing and gets shot dead. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray shoots the gunman, who falls to the floor. UPSTAIRS

dialogue.text: Booth is standing and gets shot dead. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Ray shoots the gunman, who falls to the floor. UPSTAIRS

segments.content: Ray!
INT. POLICE STATION Booth is dead so Chris leaves him there. INT. FAMILY HOUSE

dialogue.text: INT. POLICE STATION Booth is dead so Chris leaves him there. INT. FAMILY HOUSE

segments.content: (To gunman's body on the floor) Hey..
you okay?
Gunman 2 looks away for a second and Michelle kicks him down

heading.subject: the stairs. As he tumbles down Ray reloads his shotgun. The two
heading.raw_text: the stairs. As he tumbles down Ray reloads his shotgun. The two

segments.content: begin firing at each other, taking cover behind the furniture.
Tried to warn ya Chris. Didn't want
this to happen.
One of the men outside has a canister. Watkins gives him the
nod and he begins walking towards the station. Chris is beneath
the floor and shoots him in the legs. The two remaining men outside

heading.subject: open fire again. Another gunman tries to approach but he's shot
heading.raw_text: open fire again. Another gunman tries to approach but he's shot

segments.content:
in the legs as well. Watkins enters the station and fires repeatedly 

               at the floor.
Come get some! WOOOOOOOOO!
Deni fires off some shots. Watkins is distracted by the shots, Chris appears in the floor hole and blasts Watkins at close range with a shotgun.

dialogue.text: Deni fires off some shots. Watkins is distracted by the shots, Chris appears in the floor hole and blasts Watkins at close range with a shotgun.

segments.content: Chris climbs out of the hole and they hug. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Shots are still being fired in the lounge. Ray and the gunman begin to wrestle. Ray wins and punches the man repeatedly. Chris has come back to the house and tries to pull Ray off the man, Ray mistakenly hits Chris in the face.

dialogue.text: Chris climbs out of the hole and they hug. INT. FAMILY HOUSE Shots are still being fired in the lounge. Ray and the gunman begin to wrestle. Ray wins and punches the man repeatedly. Chris has come back to the house and tries to pull Ray off the man, Ray mistakenly hits Chris in the face.

segments.content: Chris helps Ray over to a chair, Ray has taken a shot to the leg. The injured gunman from the kitchen appears brandishing a pistol.

dialogue.text: Chris helps Ray over to a chair, Ray has taken a shot to the leg. The injured gunman from the kitchen appears brandishing a pistol.

segments.content: Chris and Ray hold up their hands. He aims at Ray but he's shot in the back of the head by Dad who is approaching down the stairs.

character.name: You stabbed me... with a potato peeler??

dialogue.text: Chris and Ray hold up their hands. He aims at Ray but he's shot in the back of the head by Dad who is approaching down the stairs.

segments.content: Dad nods. EXT. THE MILL Chris is in a police car driving at speed. He approaches the mill and busts through the locked gates. INT. THE MILL The mill is dark, Chris is finding his way around using a torch. He finds Jay sitting.

dialogue.text: Dad nods. EXT. THE MILL Chris is in a police car driving at speed. He approaches the mill and busts through the locked gates. INT. THE MILL The mill is dark, Chris is finding his way around using a torch. He finds Jay sitting.

segments.content: Hey Chris.
Get up Jay.
Just a sec. Remember we used to play
hide n seek up here?
Jay hits a metal saw which resonates making a metallic sound.
That was my favourite sound.
Jay stands up and holds up his hands.

dialogue.text: Jay stands up and holds up his hands.

segments.content: Jay hits a switch on the floor which opens a hatch. Chris falls into the hatch but hangs onto the saw which is swinging over it. Jay hits more switches, powering up the machinery.

dialogue.text: Jay hits a switch on the floor which opens a hatch. Chris falls into the hatch but hangs onto the saw which is swinging over it. Jay hits more switches, powering up the machinery.

segments.content: You wanna know what my new favourite
sound's gonna be? The sound of you screaming
like a little bitch.
Jay hits Chris in the stomach with a pole a few times. Chris
grabs the pole and they both fall. Chris has hurt his leg. Chris
stumbles off into the woods. Jay grabs an axe and goes after
him, he swings the axe but misses and they both fall down a large
earthy embankment. At the bottom they come to their senses and
begin fighting again, Jay with his axe and Chris with a log he's
ripped off a tree. Chris knocks Jay out by hitting him hard in
the legs.
You're right Jay, this does change our
relationship. This is my town, you're
under arrest.
Chris and Ray are packing everything, the place is boarded up.
That oughta do it. WHAT are you doin?
Gettin some souvenirs, I'm gonna miss
the place!
That's how it starts. Next you'll be
accepting bribes, setting speed traps
all over town, cuttin up trucks. Not
to mention the cavity searches.
Speakin of which, do you think Jay's
got a casino in the pen?
Could be.
Runnin the shower tower with the felons.
He's probably blowin on somebody's dice
right now.
They laugh as they drive off. The mill makes a horn noise.
That's lunch.
Let's go pick my old man and grab somethin
to eat.
FADE OUT

dialogue.text: FADE OUT
